required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Eruption Status of Primary Teeth in Low Birth Weight Children in Comparison to Normal Birth Weight Childern
clinical_study.official_title: Eruption Status of Primary Teeth and BMI in Low Birth Weight Children in Comparison to Normal Birth Weight Children

brief_summary.textblock: determine the status of eruption of primary teeth and physical growth in children aged from 6 to 36 months with low birth weight in comparison to normal birth weight

detailed_description.textblock:
Timing of eruption of primary teeth is an urgent question for every mother especially in low birth weight children. Although, the timing of eruption of primary teeth and their sequence of eruption shown to be under the genetic control , pre-natal maternal conditions, early childhood metabolic and nutritional factors along with socioeconomic states have been associated with the timing of eruption of primary teeth.
Many factors may affect the timing of eruption. Literature showed that factors like gender, race and physical growth may influence emergence of tooth in child mouth but there is scarce information on Egyptian children .

primary_outcome.measure: status of eruption of primary teeth

secondary_outcome.description: weight in kilograms height in centimeter weight and height will be combined to report BMI in kg/m^2

clinical_study.condition: Eruption Statues of Primary Teeth in LBW Children

study_pop.textblock: healthy children aged from 6 months to 36 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy children.
- Children aged from 6 to 36 month.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal of participation from the parents.
- Medically compromised children.
- Major illness.
- The child had special needs.
- Any systemic disease.
- Any congenital deformity that may affect teeth eruption.

reference.citation: Shaweesh AI, Al-Batayneh OB. Association of weight and height with timing of deciduous tooth emergence. Arch Oral Biol. 2018 Mar;87:168-171. doi: 10.1016/j.archoralbio.2017.12.030. Epub 2017 Dec 29.
Soliman NL, El-Zainy MA, Hassan RM, Aly RM. Relationship of deciduous teeth emergence with physical growth. Indian J Dent Res. 2012 Mar-Apr;23(2):236-40. doi: 10.4103/0970-9290.100433.
